p: During 2-week growth cycles, very different increments in both fresh and dry biomasses were recorded depending on the inoculum to volume-of-medium ratio. These increases ranged from 4.92 through 2.62 to 1.81 times (fresh biomass), and from 5.02 through 2.48 to 1.87 times (dry biomass) ( Figure 2). As was the case with the agar cultures, with an increase in the size of inoculum there was a gradual decrease in biomass increments.
